name: Intuit
title: Dual AI Tracks: Foresight for Products, CoE for Operations, GenOS Mediating Both

classification.classificationRationale: Decision tree: Formal AI unit=YES (Intuit Foresight) → Publishes research=NO (platform/product AI is primary output) → Central team=YES → Builds+Enables=YES → Shared AI infrastructure (GenOS) with bidirectional flow=YES → 3+ domain spokes (TurboTax, QuickBooks, Credit Karma, Mailchimp)=YES → M4. Secondary M2: Ivan Lazarov's 'How Intuit Works' CoE is a separate inward-facing AI transformation track with cross-functional teams and three-level goal framework. G8 checked: true bidirectional hub-spoke — hub provides GenOS platform/standards/models, spokes feed back domain requirements and data. VP of AI (Nhung Ho) sits on spoke side leading applied AI in product groups, confirming spoke-level AI capacity.

description:
Intuit operates a well-developed hub-and-spoke AI structure anchored by two distinct organizational mechanisms. The hub is 'Intuit Foresight,' a few-hundred-person unit created in mid-2025 when CAIO Ashok Srivastava merged the existing AI/ML team with the Futures team (quantum computing, blockchain, emerging tech). Foresight has three functional pillars — analytics, data infrastructure, and AI/ML — and builds the GenOS platform that product teams across TurboTax, QuickBooks, Credit Karma, and Mailchimp depend on for AI development [intuit-genos-press-release] [hdsr-srivastava-interview].

Separately, VP of Technology Ivan Lazarov leads the 'How Intuit Works' initiative through a Center of Excellence model focused on internal AI transformation — automating operations, changing how Intuit itself works [bain-lazarov-interview]. This creates a dual AI structure: outward-facing product AI innovation (Foresight under CAIO) and inward-facing operational AI transformation (CoE under VP Technology). Lazarov's three-level goal framework (Level 1: commitments with accountability, Level 2: aspirational with flexible timelines, Level 3: 'big and audacious' moonshot thinking) is a contextual ambidexterity mechanism that legitimizes speculative exploration within an accountability-driven culture [bain-lazarov-interview].

GenOS — Intuit's proprietary generative AI operating system — mediates between hub and spokes. Its four components (GenStudio sandbox, GenRuntime orchestration with embedded security/risk/fraud framework, GenUX component library, AI Workbench with LLM leaderboard) enable product teams to go from idea to live customer experiment 'in just days' [intuit-genos-press-release]. The platform supports a multi-model strategy: proprietary models alongside Claude, Gemini, LLaMA, Mistral, and a $100M+ OpenAI partnership that also serves as a distribution channel (TurboTax advice inside ChatGPT reaches OpenAI's 800M weekly users) [fortune-openai-deal].

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: CAIO Srivastava reports to CTO Alex Balazs (not CEO). Srivastava leads Intuit Foresight (few hundred employees). VP of AI Nhung Ho leads applied AI teams for QuickBooks, TurboTax, Customer Success — sits on spoke side. VP Technology Ivan Lazarov leads internal CoE ('How Intuit Works'). CEO Goodarzi sets strategic direction, works directly with CAIO on key initiatives [fortune-caio-appointment] [hdsr-srivastava-interview] [bain-lazarov-interview].
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: 8,000+ technologists out of 18,000+ total employees (nearly half). $100M+ OpenAI partnership. $20B+ MACROHARDRR data center investment (N/A — that's xAI). Foresight unit: few hundred employees across 5+ locations. July 2024 restructuring cut 1,800 (10% of workforce) while simultaneously hiring for AI roles [fortune-caio-profile] [intuit-restructuring].
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: Lazarov's three-level framework: Level 1 = achievable commitments with accountability, Level 2 = aspirational with flexible timelines acknowledging technology evolution, Level 3 = 'big and audacious' magic-wand thinking. Foresight incorporates Futures function (quantum, blockchain) with multi-year horizons alongside near-term GenOS platform development [bain-lazarov-interview].
observableMarkers.decisionRights: GenOS enables self-serve onboarding — product teams can launch AI experiments without approval gates. Governance embedded in platform (GenSRF security/risk/fraud framework) rather than committee-based review processes. CTO-CAIO pair develops AI roadmap collaboratively. Srivastava's guidance for agent teams: 'Just let them write code and experiment with customers' [fortune-caio-appointment] [intuit-genos-press-release].
observableMarkers.metrics: 60 billion ML predictions daily [hdsr-srivastava-interview]. 3,500 generative AI use cases (internal + external) in FY2025 [fortune-caio-profile]. 2M+ customers engaged with AI agents since July 2025 launch, 80%+ repeat engagement [fortune-caio-profile]. Developer velocity: 40% faster coding, 39% more code per developer YoY, 8x increase in production releases per engineer per week [fortune-caio-profile] [bain-lazarov-interview]. 11% reduction in customer support contacts via AI self-help [bain-lazarov-interview]. 7,500+ participants in biannual Global Engineering Days, ~500 GED projects using GenAI [fortune-caio-profile].

mechanisms.name: Productize Internal Operational Advantages
mechanisms.evidence: GenOS platform built for internal product teams also underpins TurboTax-inside-ChatGPT distribution deal ($100M+ OpenAI partnership). Internal AI capability becomes external distribution channel.

mechanisms.name: Deploy to Thousands Before You Know What Works
mechanisms.evidence: GenOS enables product teams to go from idea to live customer experiment 'in just days' via self-serve onboarding. 3,500 GenAI use cases in FY2025. Global Engineering Days (7,500+ participants) as mass experimentation events.

quotes.speaker: Sasan Goodarzi
quotes.quote: Companies that aren't prepared to take advantage of this AI revolution will fall behind and, over time, will no longer exist.

quotes.speaker: Sasan Goodarzi
quotes.quote: Six years ago, we shared that we're betting the entire company on data and AI.

quotes.speaker: Sasan Goodarzi
quotes.quote: To try to break out what's AI-driven is a meaningless exercise because the whole company is fueled by data and AI.

quotes.speaker: Ashok Srivastava
quotes.speakerTitle: SVP & Chief AI and Data Officer
quotes.quote: We're not just taking AI or machine learning off the shelf and deploying it.

quotes.speaker: Ashok Srivastava
quotes.speakerTitle: SVP & Chief AI and Data Officer
quotes.quote: Just let them write code and experiment with customers.

quotes.speaker: Ivan Lazarov
quotes.quote: Mere efficiency is just AI table stakes.

quotes.speaker: Sandeep Aujla
quotes.quote: It's the customer's data, and it remains on our platform. Our standards for stewardship haven't changed one bit.

layers.label: CAIO Appointment + Intuit Foresight Creation
layers.summary: Srivastava promoted from CDO (8-year tenure) to CAIO. Combined AI/ML team with Futures team into Intuit Foresight. GenOS platform enhanced with AI Workbench and multi-model support. $100M+ OpenAI partnership. Lazarov's CoE running parallel internal transformation track.

layers.label: AI Restructuring
layers.summary: 1,800 employees laid off (10% of workforce). 1,050 for performance, 300 for operational streamlining, 10% reduction in executive roles. Simultaneously hiring for AI expertise. CEO frames as existential: companies that don't embrace AI 'will no longer exist.'

openQuestions: How does the CAIO→CTO reporting line affect Foresight's latitude for long-horizon exploration vs. nearer-term technology delivery?
Does the dual AI track (Foresight for products, CoE for operations) create coordination overhead or productive specialization?
How does GenOS handle the tension between self-serve speed (product teams launch experiments in days) and risk governance (GenSRF framework)?
What happens to the Futures function (quantum, blockchain) now that it's merged with operational AI — does it retain exploratory latitude?
taxonomyFeedback: The dual AI track (outward-facing Foresight + inward-facing CoE) is the clearest evidence yet for the two-dimensions-of-tacit-information hypothesis. Foresight acquires NEW knowledge (AI frontiers, emerging tech). CoE embeds EXISTING knowledge (operational AI adoption). GenOS mediates between them.

Platform-mediated governance (GenSRF embedded in GenOS) vs. committee-based governance is an unnamed mechanism. The platform carries both enabling and constraining functions — governance as code rather than governance as process.

CAIO reporting to CTO rather than CEO is analytically significant. Compare: JPMorgan CDAO on Operating Committee (CEO-level), Salesforce AI leader reporting structure changed 3 times in 3 years, SK Telecom AI CIC head promoted to CTO (dual hat). The reporting line signals whether AI is treated as technology capability or strategic function.

Srivastava's explicit caution against premature AI lab creation — 'organized data, established AI platforms, and talent' as prerequisites — is the data-foundation-sequencing-constraint articulated from the inside.
